marklogic.body: "Priests for Life", not one of whom can get pregnant, are fighting this law. Individual people have ethics and make decisions for themselves, even Catholic and evangelical women. These articles never seem to mention that many denominations and religions agree with birth control and sometimes even support abortion rights. This is not a monolithic country. No one has to use birth control who does not want it. I suffered for almost 10 years with debilitating menstral cycles before receiving the pill in my 20's. Often was anemic from the excessive weeklong Bleeding and had to take Off school and work due to cramps. Of course, my insurance did not pay for it and I even at one time resorted to giving another name at the health department because I did not have the money. ( My workplace employment system was tied in with the health department and I valued my privacy.).
